all_the_buzz.database_operations.abstract_record module

class all_the_buzz.database_operations.abstract_record.DatabaseAccessObject(table_name: str, client: MongoClient, database_name: str)

Bases: ABC

This class is an abstract class that all DAO objects extend from to access their corresponding collections. Each extension can define a custom ROLE_MATRIX for role-based acessed control.

ROLE_MATRIX = {'create': ['Employee', 'Manager'], 'delete': ['Employee', 'Manager'], 'read': ['Employee', 'Manager'], 'update': ['Employee', 'Manager']}
clear_credentials() → None

Clears any set credentials by setting the current one t “None”

create_record(entry: dict[str, Any]) → ResponseCode

Creates a record with the entry data given

Parameters:

entry (dict[str, Any]) – a dictionary of fields and values to add to the collection

Returns:

After being wrapped, it will return a ResponseCode with InsertOneResult

Return type:

ResponseCode (ResponseCode)

delete_record(ID: str) → ResponseCode

Deletes a record of a given ID

Parameters:

ID (str) – a string corresponding to a MongoDB _id value

Returns:

After being wrapped, it will return a ResponseCode with the deleted_count ({1}) as data

Return type:

ResponseCode (ResponseCode)

delete_record_by_field(filter: dict[str, Any]) → ResponseCode

Deletes a record of a given filter

Parameters:

filter (dict[str, Any]) – a dictionary corresponding to the field to check and the value by which to filter

Returns:

After being wrapped, it will return a ResponseCode with the deleted_count as data

Return type:

ResponseCode (ResponseCode)

get_all_records(limit: int = None) → ResponseCode

Return all (or the first x) MongoDB documents from a collection

Parameters:

limit (int optional) – an integer that determines the number of records to send back. By default, it is set to None and returns the entire set of documents

Returns:

After being wrapped, it will return a ResponseCode with the JSON documents from the collection as data

Return type:

ResponseCode (ResponseCode)

get_credentials()
get_random(numReturned: int = 1, filter: dict[str, Any] = None) → ResponseCode

Return a set number of random records given an optional filter

Parameters:

  • numReturned (int optional) – an integer that determines the number of documents returned. Defaults to 1

  • filter (dict[str, Any] optional) – a dictionary corresponding to the fields to check and the values by which to filter

Returns:

After being wrapped, it will return a ResponseCode with the JSON documents as data

Return type:

ResponseCode (ResponseCode)

get_short_record(numReturned: int, filter: dict[str, Any] = None, max_length: int = 80) → ResponseCode

Return a set number of random records given an optional filter that also have a content less than the given max_length

Parameters:

  • numReturned (int optional) – an integer that determines the number of documents returned. Defaults to 1

  • filter (dict[str, Any] optional) – a dictionary corresponding to the fields to check and the values by which to filter

  • max_length (int optional) – an integer that determines the max_length of the content field. Defaults to 80

Returns:

After being wrapped, it will return a ResponseCode with the JSON documents as data

Return type:

ResponseCode (ResponseCode)

static rbac_action(action: str)

Wraps a function to ensure that it can be called with the current credential’s permissions

Parameters:

  • action (str) – which action to check in the ROLE_MATRIX with the credential’s title

  • func (Callable) – base function to be wrapped

Returns:

a decorator that will return a ResponseCode with the error or result of the passed in function or not even run the function if the ROLE_MATRIX does not give permission

Return type:

decorator (function(?))

set_credentials(credentials: Credentials) → None

Sets the current credentials of the DAO

Parameters:

credentials (Credentials) – the credentials given by the authorization server to use for role-based access control

update_record(ID: str, updates: dict[str, Any]) → ResponseCode

Updates a record of a given ID with given updates

Parameters:

  • ID (str) – a string corresponding to a MongoDB _id value

  • updates (dict[str, Any]) – a dictionary corresponding to the fields to change and the values to change to

Returns:

After being wrapped, it will return a ResponseCode with the matched_count and modified_count ({1, 1}) as data

Return type:

ResponseCode (ResponseCode)

all_the_buzz.database_operations.abstract_record.mongo_safe(func)

Wraps a function to ensure that a ResponseCode is always returned and that the result of a given function is added to data.

Parameters:

func (Any) – base function to be wrapped

Returns:

a wrapper that will return a ResponseCode with the error or result of the passed in function

Return type:

wrapper (function)
